page.title: 19General Information
page.content:
Dilhorne is administered by a Parish Council of seven elected members of the village. It meets every third Wednesday of each month in Dilhorne School.
There is no policeman or house in the village, petrols come from Cheadle. For Doctors and their surgeries you would have to visit Cheadle or Blythe Bridge. Likewise all entertainment,such as cinema's would be found in the Potteries.
The Foxfield Coalmine closed in 1967 but its mineral line railway has now been turned into a Steam Railway by local enthusiasts.Much of this lineis to be found in this area but its HQ comes under Blythe Bridge.
Secondary Education takes place in Cheadle and Blythe Bridge.
